snippet: The Economic Development Corporation will break into two parts as the group and two other organizations agreed to a settlement with the state attorney general.
abstract: New York City's Economic Development Corp, and two other organizations formed as part of Bloomberg administration efforts to redevelop Willets Point in Queens and portions of Brooklyn's Coney Island, admit to lobbying illegally to aid mayor's plans; in settlement with the state attorney general's office, all three agree to take steps toward reform.
lead_paragraph: The Economic Development Corporation will break into two parts as the group and two other organizations agreed to a settlement with the state attorney general.

headline.seo: Economic Development Corporation and 2 Other Groups Admit to Illegal Lobbying
headline.main: Groups Admit to Lobbying Illegally to Aid Mayor’s Plans
headline.print_headline: Groups Admit To Lobbying Illegally to Aid Mayor’s Plans
